intro: Pteronia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly pteronia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established. The flowers bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
